newsitem.title: USA: Children's Broadcasting seeks more shares.
newsitem.headline: Children's Broadcasting seeks more shares.

text.p: Children's Broadcasting Corp in a proxy for its September 30 annual meeting said it seeks shareholder approval to increase the number of authorized shares to 50 million from 12.5 million.
It also seeks approval to amend its 1994 Stock Option Plan by increasing the number of shares reserved under that plan to one million from 250,000.
At August 15, 1996, there were 5.6 million shares of common stock outstanding and 2.7 million shares reserved for use with stock options, warrants or conversion of convertible debt.
Children's Broadcasting, a children's radio programming network headquartered in Minneapolis, said it has no specific plans to use the additional authorized shares it seeks.
